meanings.definition: To provide with necessary items or equipment.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will equip the students with pencils and notebooks for the exam.
meanings.sent2: It is important to equip your car with a spare tire in case of a flat.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to equip the salad with a bow tie, thinking it would make it fancier.
meanings.sent4: She equipped her mind with knowledge, ready to face any challenge that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The superhero was equipped with a special suit that gave him incredible powers.

meanings.definition: To furnish with the qualities necessary for performance.
meanings.sent1: The coach will equip the team with the skills needed to win the game.
meanings.sent2: She equipped herself with confidence before giving her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to equip his jokes with rocket boosters, hoping they would take off.
meanings.sent4: His determination equipped him with the strength to overcome any obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The artist was equipped with creativity, painting masterpieces that amazed everyone.
